meanings.definition: The quality of having multiple meanings or interpretations.
meanings.sent1: Her multivalence in the play confused the audience.
meanings.sent2: The multivalence of the word 'run' can mean different things in various contexts.
meanings.sent3: The multivalence of his jokes left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The multivalence of the painting allowed viewers to see different stories within it.
meanings.sent5: The multivalence of the symbol made it open to various explanations.

meanings.definition: The state of being capable of taking on multiple forms or roles.
meanings.sent1: The actor's multivalence on stage impressed the director.
meanings.sent2: The multivalence of the material made it suitable for various applications.
meanings.sent3: The robot's multivalence in performing tasks was both impressive and amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her multivalence in the workplace made her an invaluable team member.
meanings.sent5: The multivalence of the tool allowed it to be used in different ways.
